channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: At NATO, Biden aims to prove doubters wrong. And, should minors buy zero-proof drinks?
item.description: President Biden's speech at the NATO summit emphasized a bipartisan commitment to the alliance. Health researchers push for age restrictions on who can buy non-alcoholic drinks.
item.content:encoded:
President Biden's speech at the NATO summit emphasized a bipartisan commitment to the alliance. Health researchers push for age restrictions on who can buy non-alcoholic drinks.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Alec Baldwin is on trial for involuntary manslaughter
item.description: Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed in 2021 when a prop gun went off on the western film Rust set. Alec Baldwin is charged with involuntary manslaughter and faces up to 18 months behind bars.
item.content:encoded:
Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed in 2021 when a prop gun went off on the western film Rust set. Alec Baldwin is charged with involuntary manslaughter and faces up to 18 months behind bars.

(Image credit: Evan Agostini/Invision)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: Lawmakers on Capitol Hill are expected to ask the Fed chair about interest rates
item.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell visits Capitol Hill on Wednesday to take questions on the economy and interest rates.
item.content:encoded: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell visits Capitol Hill on Wednesday to take questions on the economy and interest rates.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: What did NATO members take away from President Biden’s speech?
item.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks to Rachel Rizzo of the Atlantic Council’s Europe Center, about whether Biden's speech reassured allies that the U.S. will continue to support Ukraine.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer talks to Rachel Rizzo of the Atlantic Council’s Europe Center, about whether Biden's speech reassured allies that the U.S. will continue to support Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Sacha Pfeiffer

item.title: Iran tried to kill her on U.S. soil. The plot failed, but she lives in its shadow
item.description: In 2022, a hitman was allegedly hired as part of a plot hatched in Iran to assassinate Masih Alinejad, a critic of the Iranian regime, in New York. Threats continue to turn her life upside down.
item.content:encoded:
In 2022, a hitman was allegedly hired as part of a plot hatched in Iran to assassinate Masih Alinejad, a critic of the Iranian regime, in New York. Threats continue to turn her life upside down.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: These monkeys were 'notoriously competitive' until Hurricane Maria wrecked their home
item.description: Rhesus macaques on Cayo Santiago are known for being intolerant, hierarchical and aggressive. After 2017's Hurricane Maria destroyed their home, the monkeys' society underwent surprising changes.
item.content:encoded: Rhesus macaques on Cayo Santiago are known for being intolerant, hierarchical and aggressive. After 2017's Hurricane Maria destroyed their home, the monkeys' society underwent surprising changes.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: NPR investigation reveals information about death row in Texas
item.description: State law shields information about the process of lethal injection. A new NPR investigation finds where the drug comes from.
item.content:encoded: State law shields information about the process of lethal injection. A new NPR investigation finds where the drug comes from.
item.dc:creator: Chiara Eisner

item.title: Spain advances to the European soccer championship final after beating France
item.description: A 16-year-old became the youngest player ever to score a goal at the European Championship, powering Spain’s advance to the finals with a 2-1 victory over France.
item.content:encoded: A 16-year-old became the youngest player ever to score a goal at the European Championship, powering Spain’s advance to the finals with a 2-1 victory over France.
item.dc:creator: Miguel Macias

item.title: Georgia law now makes it easier for citizens to challenge a voter's eligibility
item.description: In the battleground state of Georgia, it's easier for anyone to challenge voter registrations of people without permanent addresses. Critics say voters who are homeless could be silenced.
item.content:encoded: In the battleground state of Georgia, it's easier for anyone to challenge voter registrations of people without permanent addresses. Critics say voters who are homeless could be silenced.
item.dc:creator: Stephannie Stokes

item.title: Artificial intelligence's thirst for electricity
item.description: Artificial intelligence is an electricity hog. Google says its total greenhouse gas emissions climbed nearly 50% over five years, mostly due to electricity that powers AI data centers.
item.content:encoded: Artificial intelligence is an electricity hog. Google says its total greenhouse gas emissions climbed nearly 50% over five years, mostly due to electricity that powers AI data centers.
item.dc:creator: Dara Kerr
